Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, dilute line at bottom of band, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; top of rim glazed; exterior: frieze of reversed S between pairs of dilute lines at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of face and hair (with red patch) of sphinx, to left; part of pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 257, no. 466, pl. 63) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.476.b.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0510) (phase 2)
